utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s like the tenth time I’ve peed since I’ve been here!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s also like the tenth time you told us.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, oh I’m sorry, it must be really hard to hear! I tell ya, it’s a lot easier having three babies play Bringing in the Noise, Bringing in da Funk on your bladder! I’m so sick of being pregnant! The only happiness I get is from a cup of coffee, which of course is decaf, ‘cause—Oh! I’m pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pheebs, did…you want a cookie?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So uh, Pheebs, honey, how are those mood swings coming?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I haven’t really had any yet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, here’s the ring.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! Yes! A thousand times, yes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, any ideas for the bachelor party yet?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa! Before you start handing out wedding rings and planning bachelor parties, don’t you have to decide who your best man is gonna be?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, it’s awkward. It’s awkward. It’s awkward.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I sort’ve already asked Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! He got to do it at your first wedding!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, I figured you’d understand. I mean, I-I’ve known him a lot longer.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on Ross! Look, I-I don’t have any brothers; I’ll never get to be a best man!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You can be the best man when I get married.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’ll never get to be a best man!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait-wait, so, you get to be my best man twice and I never get to be yours at all?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, you—yeah, of course you get to be my best man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What about me?! You-you just said I could!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not even getting married! Okay, this is a question for science fiction writers!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re not picking me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, how can it not be me?!HeyHey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not even… I’m not even…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine, y’know what, that’s it. From now on, Joey, I want you to be my best man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! Shame about you man.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: One of the babies is kicking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I thought that was a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s not kicking me, it’s kicking one of the other babies. Oh ! Don’t make me come in there!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you guys have like a big bowl I can borrow?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, there’s one right under the cabinet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why do you need it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, we’re having a big party tomorrow night. Later!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa! Hey-hey, you planning on inviting us?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nooo, later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!! Get your ass back here, Tribbiani!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hormones!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What Phoebe meant to say was umm, how come you’re having a party and we’re not invited?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, it’s Ross’s bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sooo?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you bachelors?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you strippers?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then you’re not invited.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right fine! You’re not invited to the party we’re gonna have either.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-whoa, what party?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well umm…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The baby shower for Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don’t want to do! Later!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe I’m gonna have a party! This is so great! A party! Yay!! I don’t know why.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is what I’ve got going for the party so far, liquor wise. Get a lot of liquor.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Great. Great.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, now uh, in terms of the invite list, I’ve got you, me, and Chandler and I’m gonna invite Gunther ‘cause, well, we’ve been talking about this pretty loud.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: I’ll be there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right—oh! Listen, I know this is your party, but I’d really like to the number of museum geeks that are gonna be there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Tell ya what, let’s not invite any of the anthropologists, only the dinosaur dudes!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! We’ll need a six-pack of Zima.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey guys, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, just planning my bachelor party with my best man.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, good luck trying to top the last one.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, see, I don’t think it’s gonna that difficult considering this one won’t be taking place in the basement of a Pizza Hut.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I’m Ross. I’m Ross. I’m too good for the Hut; I’m too good for the Hut.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I gotta go pick up Ben. Everything so far sounds great Joey, just remember to keep it on the mellow side, okay? Just a couple of guys hanging out playing poker, no-no strippers or anything okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, see ya later.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See ya. Have fun planning your mellow bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, there’s gonna be strippers there. He didn’t say anything about no strippers.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He just said, "No strippers."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I chose not to hear that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look what I got! Look what I got! Look what I got! Can you believe they make these for little people?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Little village people.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, look at this one. This is my favourite.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that is so sweet!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know! Phoebe is gonna love dressing them in these!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh. Except, Phoebe’s not gonna be the one that gets to dress them.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because she’s not gonna get to keep the babies.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! We are throwing the most depressing baby shower ever!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute! Unless, we give her all gifts she can use after she’s done being pregnant. Like-like umm, regular coffee, Tequila.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, and somebody can get those leather pants she’s always wanted!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, she’s gonna love that!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What the hell is this?! What, did you actually thought it would make me feel better to give me stuff that I can’t use for another two months?! This sucks! All right, what’s my next present?!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: I don’t have anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey listen man, about the stripper…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good call!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, a little announcement, a little announcement. I’ve decided that my best man is, my best friend Gunther!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: What’s my last name?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Thanks for not marrying Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don’t-don’t forget your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey-hey, what are those?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, little party favours, check it out!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-oh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, okay, a little announcement, I just want everyone to know that the position of my best man is still open! And uh, so is the position of the bride.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Smooth man. Yeah, you got some chilie on your neck. Well, I just want to say, thanks everyone, this-this was great. And hey! See you guys Monday morning. Thanks Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, hey, don’t forget your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, thanks!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, hey, museum geeks, party’s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice lady. There you go. Back to your parent’s basement. All right. Come on boys, come on out! Here you go. All right.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Ohhh, look at the little birdies! Are those yours?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Wow, I didn’t know they let you keep chickens and ducks as pets.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the wall. Hardly move. Be white.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: You are really good at that. So uh, I had fun tonight, you throw one hell of a party.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin’ ya. And listen if any of my friends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday…

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Yeah, that would be great. So I guess umm, good night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ll let you play with my duck.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, stripper!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The stripper stole the ring!! The stripper stole the ring!! Chandler! Chandler, get up! Get up! The stripper stole the ring!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The ring is gone!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ugh. Just a sec, give me a minute to wake up for this—Ah-ha-ha!! You lost the ring! You’re the worst best man ever!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, this isn’t funny! What am I gonna do?! I go to bed last night, everything’s cool! I wake up this morning, the stripper’s gone and the ring is gone!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You slept with the stripper?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Of course!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, guys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I wanted to apologise if I—y’know seemed a tad edgy yesterday at my shower. Y’know it’s just the hormones, y’know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No we…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hormones.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …hormones, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Anyway, I just wanted to say thank you, it was just, it was so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow, you seem to be doing so much better. That’s great. So how-how are things going?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good. Y’know—no-no, okay, it’s-it feels like everything’s been about me lately, so what’s happening with you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, actually we were just talking about me not going to Ross’s wedding.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It just might be too hard, given the history and all that…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! This reminds me of the time when I was umm, living on the street and this guy offered to buy me food if I slept with him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, h-how is this like that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, let’s see, it’s not. Really, like that. Because, you see that was an actual problem, and uh, yours is just like y’know a bunch of y’know high school crap that nobody really gives y’know…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m-I’m sorry, I just thought that…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alrighty, here come the water works.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ugh! I don’t know what I’m going to do! I called the company that sent and th-they don’t care! Then I called 9-1-1 and they laughed at me, if this isn’t an emergency, then what is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just wanted to thank you again for last night, what a great party! And the guys from work had a blast. Y’know, one of them had never been to a bachelor party before. Yeah! And-and another one had never been to a party before, so…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that’s nice!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, right!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for myself, I might want to get one of those…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That ring? When my grandmother first came to this country, that ring and the clothes on her back were all she had with her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you might say, the ring is irreplaceable?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh absolutely! It has been in my family for generations, and every bride who has worn it has had a long and happy life.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you might say, it’s a magic ring.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, the stripper stole it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My-my ring? My-my wedding ring? The-the stripper stole my wedding ring?! H-how?! How could this all happen?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I think it all started when you said, "Hey Joey, why don’t you be my best man."

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right-all right, fine! I-I’m gonna call the cops!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, I screwed up, you don’t have to turn me in!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not on you! On the stripper!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, well I already did that! They said they’re gonna look into it right after they solved all the murders.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, well, we’ll call the company that sent her!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I did that too! They wouldn’t give me her real name or her number. They said, "If I bothered them again they’d call the police." I said, "If you talk to the police, you tell them I’m missing a ring!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So what, Joey? Wh-wh-what? What are you telling me? That there’s nothing we can do? Well, how could this happen?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look Ross, I am so-so sorry. I-I-I…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, what if we just ah, called her, used a fake name, and had her come to my office?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds like fun, but we’ve got a ring to find!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here’s your tea Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s so good. Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m so glad you liked it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! She made the tea!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! No, I-I think I just had a contraction.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought I had one a couple of minutes ago, and now I know that was definitely one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, you can’t have the baby here! I mean I haven’t sterilised it since the guys moved out!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. It’s okay. We’re gonna be okay. Y’know what? It’s okay. I’m gonna, I’m gonna, I’m gonna boil some water and just rip up some sheets!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. It’s all right; it’s probably false labour. They said that, that can happen near the end, just somebody get the book.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, get the book! The book!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! Here!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The Bible?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, okay, this is great, uh, Chandler, you get behind the desk. And-and when she comes in hopefully, she won’t recognise you because, well, why would she? Uh, okay, and then you buzz Ross and I. You be Mr. Gonzalez, and I’ll be uh, Mr. Wong.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Diverse.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Did anybody call for security?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You be cool.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Okay, which one of you guys is Gunther Central-Perk? Hey, Joey?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where’s my ring? My dead grandmother’s wedding ring? Where is it? Where is it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Way to be cool, man.

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: What’s he talking about?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There was a ring, in a box, on my nightstand, after you left, it was gone!

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Wait, you guys think I stole some ring?

utterance.speaker: The Guys
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We know you took so just-just save yourself the time and confess!

utterance.speaker: The Stripper
utterance.content: Okay, who are you? The Hardy boys? Look, I don’t need to steal some stupid ring, all right? I make $1,600 a week doing what I do; any of you guys make that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Marry me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t get it! It was in my room all night! And if she didn’t take it, and I didn’t take it; and you didn’t take it, then who did? Shh! We’re trying to think!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I still don’t get how you know when it’s false labour.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, do you see any babies?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How do you feel?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I guess. I mean… I don’t know, it’s just, I guess I know it’s going to be over soon.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, isn’t that a good thing? You said you were sick of this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know. It’s just y’know usually when you’re, when you’re done with the pregnant thing, y’know, then you get to do the mom thing. I’m gonna be y’know, sitting around in my leather pants, drinking Tequila.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Some moms do that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay that’s even sadder. Look, I know, I know what I got myself into, it’s just that now that they’re in me it’s like, it’s like I know them y’know, I mean-I mean, it’s just not gonna be easy when these little babies have to go away.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aww, sweetie, but it’s not like you’re not gonna have anything. You’re gonna have nieces and nephews, and some ways that’s even better.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, really. Really, Pheebs, you’re not gonna be the one worrying about saving for college, or yelling at them when they’re bad, y’know, or deciding to put them on Ritalin when they just won’t calm down. Y’know?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean, you’re the one they’re gonna come to when they wanna run away from home, and the one they talk to about sex.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you just get to be cool Aunt Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Cool Aunt Phoebe. I am pretty cool!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And y’know what else, oh my God, are they gonna love you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: They are gonna love me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks you guys! Again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re the best. Thanks. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica and Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Just kidding. Ahh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Got cha again, you guys are so easy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If anything should happen to him…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey! The vet said it’s a simple procedure.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So! Things can go wrong! You don’t know! What if he doesn’t make it?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He will, Joe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if he doesn’t? He’s such a good duck.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m so worried about him, y’know?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Somebody lose a ring?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God! Thank you! Thank you so much!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: H-h-h-how’s the duck?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: He’s doing just fine, he’s resting now, but you can see him in a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh, great! Oh hey, listen Ross, thanks for being so cool about this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, that’s all right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, it’s not. I mean you-you made me your best man and I totally let you down!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, come on, it’s not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it is! You wouldn’t have lost the ring, right? Y’know what, Ross you were right from the start, he should be your best man.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, you should.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now, don’t argue with me…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Hey! I get to choose my best man, and I want both you guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, both you guys should be up there with me. I mean, you two are-are my… I mean, I’m lucky to have just one good…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I gotta go check something over here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What a baby.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Total wuss!
